result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont Terrence Goss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Obtain and maintain full time employment, unless programming needs conflict.  Agent to determine.  Work towards obtaining GED or HSED.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.
Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with the victims, their residence or place of employment.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent. 

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Write a letter of apology to the victims on how this crime affected them.  Agent to pre-approve.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments through probation.  Must be paid in full before discharge.

timeConds.notes: May serve in Eau Claire County.  Huber allowed according to jail rules, if he has full time employment, other than with his family.   May serve on EMP if they have the ability to monitor his sobriety.  Sentence to start on or before October 23, 2015 at 6:00 P.M.  Stay to be lifted immediately if he commits any other crimes.  AMENDED 10/22/15.  Sentence to start on or before October 30, 2015 at 6:00 P.M.  Stay to be lifted immediately if he commits any other crimes.
To be completed within the first year of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Amended 5-4-18:  Jail credit is amended to 303 days

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  Any amounts remaining due, to be paid on a regular monthly basis through his agent, during extended supervision.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
A civil judgment is ordered for unpaid court costs.
Obtain and maintain employment commensurate with his treatment needs.
No contact with the vicims, unless they request contact and the agent approves.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

Defendant to be subject to frequent and random testing by his agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Granting additional jail credit
Sent to Judge
from DOC
Sentencing after revocation 2-1-2018

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion. Victim notification complied with.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No changes or corrections, except the defendant is no longer in custody.  State recommended:  $1905.00 restitution still owing.  5-6 year sentence.  3-4 years initial confinement and 2-3 years extended supervision.  Credit for 356 days.  Extended supervision conditions.  Eligible for SAP and CIP.  Pay restitution and CC out of prison funds.  Defense recommended:  Defendant has been accepted into the Eau Claire County drug court.  1 year jail, or consecutive jail term to his Trempealeau County case.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution. Court ordered: 6 year sentence. Bifurcated as 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  Credit for 274 days.  ES conditions:    Defendant to be subject to frequent and  random testing by his agent. Maintain absolute sobriety.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.  $ restitution and CC.  Pay from prison funds. Balance pay during term of probation on a monthly payment plan.  Obtain and maintain employment commensurate with his treatment needs.  Eligible for SAP and CIP.  Judgment for unpaid court costs.  No contact with the victim unless they request and his agent approves.  Consecutive to his Trempealeau County case.  Credit follows Revocation order and warrant, less 23 days because he was released from Tremp. Co on 1/9.
Copy of SEHR NOH faxed to Trempealeau County Jail this date with the request to give to Mr. Goss.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 1, 2018 at 09:45 am.
from DOC

Joint recommendation.  3 years probation.  No contact with victims.  Restitution & surcharge.  Obtain and maintain employment.  60 hours community service due within first 6 months of probation. Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 years probation.  No contact with the victims, or their residences or places of employment..  Pay the restitution & surcharges.  Payable monthly through probation.  Pay in full prior to discharge.  Obtain and maintain employment 40 hours per week, unless programming needs conflict.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Work towards obtaining GED or HSED.  60 hours community service due within first year of probation.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC and DNA sample and surcharge.  LOA to the victims, pre approved by agent.  Subject to random drug testing.  45 days jail.  May serve in Eau Claire County.  EMP allowed if they have the ability to monitor his sobriety.  Huber allowed according to jail rules, if he has full time employment, other than his family.  Start by October 23, 2015 at 6 pm.  Commit any other crimes stay lifted immediately.
Restitution worksheet
Sentencing hearing at 10-19-2015 10:30 am

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Betthauser.  Restitution to be determined.  Plea hearing held today.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1.  Counts 2- 6 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Elements reviewed by the court with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.   Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the charge.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Court found the defendant guilty of count 1.  Sentencing set for 10/19/15 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.
Court reviewed the form with the defendant. Defendant understood the waiver.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.
